Uses of Class
structures.Spot

Packages that use Spot
Package Description
structures  
structures.pieces  

  • Uses of Spot in structures

    Fields in structures declared as Spot
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) Spot Board.lastMove
    A Spot that is used to hold the last move made on the board This will be updated after every move.
    (package private) Spot[][] Board.spotMat
    A 2-dimensional array of Spots that correspond to a chessboard and holds all the Pieces and their locations using these Spot instances
    Methods in structures that return Spot
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Spot Board.findKing​(int team)
    Looks through all Spot instances in the current Board instance's spotMat and locates the King piece of an indicated team
    Methods in structures with parameters of type Spot
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean Board.checkMove​(Spot from, Spot to, java.lang.Character promoRequest)
    checkMove determines validty first by the following means: Checking path validity as specified by the command and according to the rules of chess Determine if the move in question fits the mold of a special move This includes enpassant, castling, and promotion.
    Method parameters in structures with type arguments of type Spot
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean Board.piecesInWay​(java.util.ArrayList<Spot> path, int team)
    piecesInWay analyzes a path and determines if there are spots that would inhibit the movement of a piece that wants to move to the last Spot entry of its path.

  • Uses of Spot in structures.pieces

    Methods in structures.pieces that return types with arguments of type Spot
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Bishop.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the bishop's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> King.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the King is moving too far in the X or Y direction If the King is attempting a normal 1 square move, the path is returned If a castling attempt is detected, it will return the two squares the King will move across
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Knight.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the pawn is moving too far in the X or Y direction Determines if the Knight is making a valid move of either shifting 2 vertical 1 horizontal or shifting 1 vertical and 2 horizontal
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Pawn.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the pawn is moving too far in the X or Y direction Determines if the pawn is moving in the correct vertical direction (according to its team) Determines if the pawn is attempting to move one step forward, two steps forward Or one step diagonal forward Determines if anything might inhibit the pawn from moving in one of the above scenarios
    abstract java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Piece.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    An abstract method to return the piece's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Queen.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the queen's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Rook.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the rook's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    Methods in structures.pieces with parameters of type Spot
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Bishop.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the bishop's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> King.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the King is moving too far in the X or Y direction If the King is attempting a normal 1 square move, the path is returned If a castling attempt is detected, it will return the two squares the King will move across
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Knight.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the pawn is moving too far in the X or Y direction Determines if the Knight is making a valid move of either shifting 2 vertical 1 horizontal or shifting 1 vertical and 2 horizontal
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Pawn.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    This method determines move validity by the following measures: Determines if the pawn is moving too far in the X or Y direction Determines if the pawn is moving in the correct vertical direction (according to its team) Determines if the pawn is attempting to move one step forward, two steps forward Or one step diagonal forward Determines if anything might inhibit the pawn from moving in one of the above scenarios
    abstract java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Piece.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    An abstract method to return the piece's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Queen.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the queen's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
    java.util.ArrayList<Spot> Rook.getPath​(Spot from, Spot to)
    Implements getPath to return the rook's path of spots from Spot from to Spot to.
